attributes.action: School Holidays Term Time - Our Kids Our Decision
attributes.additional_details:
Reverse the amendments to the term time family holiday rules under The Education came into force on 1 September 2013
Why the government have such control over what we can and cannot do with our children. Families should be able to enjoy time together whenever they desire and not be criminalised for wanting to enjoy an annual family holiday. Holidays can be educational, experiencing new cultures and emotional bonding.
Take Action:
Bring back the 10 day allowance which I believe to be an amicable decision to accommodate and support children and their family’s needs. I agreed that fines may be applicable for poor attendance, truancy and anything over the 10 days allowance.
Provide evidence for the stated belief that ‘pupils are most successful when they follow an uninterrupted programme of study’ I don’t find this decision acceptable on beliefs alone. One word – strikes!
Work on lowering holidays prices.
OUR CHILDREN, OUR DECISION
